reviews.sentence: Great Bachelor Party Location. Went to Vegas for my brothers bachelor party. Stayed at Flamingo and upgraded to the Go rooms upon arrival. We were placed on the top floor and had a great view of the strip and Caesars Palace. Also the rooms connected so that was helpful. Spent most of the time at the adult pool where it was a party atmosphere all day long. The availability of pizza and gatorade on the casino floor at 4AM was a lifesaver. Haha. Only con was that our shower was a little weak pressure was a bit low and took forever to heat up but that was minor. Great place to stay as it is centrally located with plenty to do in every direction. Will definitely return.

Greta hotel flamingo. Overall swimming pool 21 and was the best great music and excellent bars casino games and more grateful place for the family buffet great food and fresh over all the staff at the casino they were super.

Nice location but rooms are very dated. Great location for sure. However the rooms are very dated. Front strip view was great and the location of the hotel is the best if you wanted to be center of all the casino action. Pool was very crowded.

Great Location. Stayed in Go Room 6 nights. Nice for price. Beds comfortable. Housekeeping should have been better. If out of room before 12 noon everything was cleaned. But on days we did not leave until after 2 not so clean and one day room was not cleaned although we called to let housekeeping know we were leaving and room was available for cleaning. They apologized but could only send up towels. Casino is in a Great location.

Casino time. Employees at the casino were very helpful friendly and quick to respond to our requests. We did not stay at this particular hotel as we traveled with another couple and their timeshare but enjoyed the casino it is location and accessibility to our hotel.

Dec2016. Nice casino hotel with indoor gym so I did not have to go anywhere for my daily exercise. Room is nice and clean with a flat screen tv. it is also nice to have food court in the casino. it will be nice if there is more parking spots for handicapped.

Great Location. The Flamingo on the strip is a great location. There are major casinos and places to go within walking distance. The service from all the staff is fantastic in my opinion. We frequented several restaurants where the food was good.

Had great time. Perfect location at the strip. There is a garden with real flamingos and many other birds fish and etc. There is a DJ at the pool a lot of fun good coctails. The stuff is nice. Ask for strip view you will not regret it. Nice and clean rooms. I would definitely go again.

Great poker tables. Flamingo is the best casino to play low stakes poker especially in the evening. The dealers are extremely friendly and helpful and players are cordial. The flamingo habitat is a must see. Tons of flamingos and other animals to see.

It was ok it was the people and events that worked. The casino staff were awesome. The bathroom and room were filthy. The shower rendered unusable with a dusty gaping hole in the tile where a vent was to a clog backing up other peoples messes at the bottom of the drain. When we complained and asked for a different room they did comp us resort fees. However this was not worth the money.

I stayed at the Flamingo from December 1 4 2017. Although the room cost and resort fee were nominal I was very disappointed with the condition of the hotel and particularly my room. 6173. Some things I will give forgiveness. Example the room is so far away from the elevators that it made it inconvenient to get to the casino. I would have played a couple of nights after taking a nap but I really did not want to trudge all the way to the casino and back. But to me the real shame was the condition of the room. If you go and inspect the room the dresser stand that the television is on is absolutely embarrassingly in bad shape. It needs to be removed and replaced with a more current dresser or at the very least it needs to be refinished. There is circuit breaker type extension cord by the sitting desk of the room. It was unplugged when I arrived. I tried plugging it in but it did not work. So that meant that the light on the desk did not operate either. I was afraid it was a fire hazard for it to be plugged in so I left everything unplugged my entire stay. Over the sink is a florescent light and the diffuser on it like a grate was not sitting correctly on the fixture. There was dust literally hanging from both sides of the diffuser. In the bathroom there is a small grate over the bathtub. I am not sure if that was a vent or not because i did not hear it operating. But if you look at the grate it is rusted and unsightly. My criticism of the hotel is not confined to the room. Walking down the hallway on the 6th floor you can see that there are doors that are marred wallpaper was peeling in some places and there was another what I presume was an air return grate which had dust on it and I doubt it had been cleaned in the past 6 months. I stayed at the Flamingo because that is where the friends that I met had decided to stay. I had be hard pressed to stay at it again given the poor condition of my room. Despite my intense criticism of the accommodations I did find the employees I encountered to be friendly and polite. Drink service was good even though I am not much of a drinker and there was a good selection of slot machines to keep me entertained. I enjoyed my time but I doubt that I would ever spend another vacation in that establishment.

Never again. Just go somewhere else until they decide to completely renovate this hotel and casino. Had to move rooms 3 times in 4 days because the air was not working. Each time we were told it was in the tower we were located in. Well it must have been every tower because absolutely none of them worked. If you do not get a upgraded room you will be very disappointed. The ones that are not upgrades. I promise you the furniture is old and terrible. I would absolutely not ever put a guest in one of those rooms. Now with that being said. They did take our resort fees off for the air conditioning trouble after multiple times of calling and them saying we ’re going to but each time I talked to a different person and finely lost my patience a bit. So yes I did n’t get charged that 130 dollars for resort fee. But I had to be very persistent and then get a little rude. We have been to Vegas before and Stayed at other places and they were GREAT. Honestly I usually would never even write a terrible review like this I would just let it be but people spend a lot of money to go to Vegas and more after they get there so It should always be a great experience. This totally was NOT.

Never again. I have stayed at the Flamingo many times but the last time was maybe 10 years ago and nothing has changed. Room was dirty faulty shower valve so it sounded like there was a water fountain in the room. no USB charger broken lamp shade and the other lamp u could not turn on and broken closet door so u could not use it. Room 4039 avoid it. Downstairs casino was typical and nothing else stood out as amazing. Actually the Center Cut Restaurant was really good along with Pif show. Room 4039 did not look anything like the picture.
I remember the Flamingo as one of the older casinos however recently it has taken on a decent facelift. However with any facelift you can only do so much. Time has taken it is toll.

The hotel really needs to improve. The room we stayed in desperately needs updating. We returned to the hotel one evening after it rained and the hotel was a MESS. Water was falling from so many places in the casino elevator lobbies etc. A bucket was put under the waterfall but no one emptied the bucket. I slipped and fell near our elevator because of the water. That is unacceptable. In the casino the garbage can was overflowing right in the middle of the walkway with no one caring to clean it up. The pool areas are so small it could not accommodate the guests. No chairs to sit in were available without a cost. We were down at the pool extremely early and still could not get a chair. As good a location of the hotel on the strip this place needs to step it up. I would love to stay again but not anytime soon. Its a shame.

One night stay. Flamingo is a centrally located property on the Las Vegas strip. There are lots of activities in addition to the casino in the surrounding area. The room was clean and shower was excellent. I was able to check in with a friend in the diamond check in area since he was a diamond card holder and I am only a gold. That saved time and also allowed us to have rooms next to each other.

Excellent. The room clean and the bed just perfect. When I arrive there is people getting people on the lobby promising 150 to spend in the casino if you go with them to see some videos of the propertys they promise breakfast. and they make you walk like half of amile to get there and they charge 40dl plus the food its just chiken with wite rice i think the food from the hospital. it is better.

Their only saving grace are the renovated rooms. My friends and I separately booked several rooms. Each one of us called ahead to see if we could be located either on the same floor or somewhat close to each other. I am not sure what the standard procedure is for this but they did not accommodate us in the slightest. We were booked on different floors and in one case an entirely different tower. Granted they are all confusingly connected but that is a lot of walking between rooms. The UPSIDE. Their newly renovated rooms are large clean and modestly decorated. Like most modern hotel rooms they opted for the sliding bathroom door. Our only qualm was that the connected door between rooms carries conversations echoes from one room to the other VERY well. that is not a plus when you do not know the neighbors next door. I have not even touched on the parking situation. When we arrived to check. in there was no parking available and the valet was shut down for diamond or whatever they call their VIPs only. they are supposed to have an electronic system that lets you know how many spaces are available on a given level but it horribly miscalculated. It tried to say there were over 200 spots available and I could not find ONE. I asked a valet guy as he was walking up the ramp what the deal was and he said it was wildly inaccurate. He added that if I tipped him I could park in a valet spot. I tipped him and that settled that. He said they almost always have spots available on the parking level so he is not sure why the system is set up the way that it is. CASINO. The property is centrally located on the strip which brings in a lot of foot traffic. I find that they have cheaper tables but the casino is on the smaller side when compared to their sister properties. As an older casino there is poor air circulation. Some seats feel like your sitting under a smokey heat lamp and others are freezing cold. The lobby lights and other decorative fixtures definitely show their age. If you are looking for a great location and big cheap rooms this is a great choice. If you are looking for those two things and then some keep shopping.

Short stay. Stayed for a few days. Spent some time in the casino playing blackjack fod was good and will be going back their one in the future. The entertainment is very good The hotel has been updated from the last time I was their.

I stayed at the Flamingo two times in May and still had to pay close to 180 bucks on a stinking Monday and Tuesday I ’ve been a Rewards member for over 10 years and still not getting good rates or offers. I spend a bunch of money in the sports bet and it does n’t do anything for my Rewards I think that ’s terrible for instance my average bet per sports bet should be around 100 bucks but never shows that on card. I hit a 5 card straight flush and the pit boss and dealer acted like nothing happened you would think then maybe a meal or room would be comped but nothing. So what happened next is they raised the minimum from 5 to 10 bucks as we were sitting there and told us we were n’t Grand Fathered in. that ’s terrible customer service all 5 of us got up and left I ’ve stayed at the Flamingo for years but why should I anymore the place is run down. you do n’t have very good entertainment or even a Bar and Grill area next to sports book and the TVs in sports book are terrible except a few. After all that I ca n’t even get a room for under 40 bucks on a week day. Please start doing something about these issues or you are going to lose a lot of people thanks.
